items.name: Ext.form.Labelable
items.text: A mixin which allows a component to be configured and decorated with a label and/or error message as is common for form fields. This is used by e.g. Ext.form.field.Base and Ext.form.FieldContainer to let them be managed by the Field layout. NOTE: This mixin is mainly for internal library use and most users should not need to use it directly. It is more likely you will want to use one of the component classes that import this mixin, such as Ext.form.field.Base or Ext.form.FieldContainer. Use of this mixin does not make a component a field in the logical sense, meaning it does not provide any logic or state related to values or validation; that is handled by the related Ext.form.field.Field mixin. These two mixins may be used separately (for example Ext.form.FieldContainer is Labelable but not a Field), or in combination (for example Ext.form.field.Base implements both and has logic for connecting the two.) Component classes which use this mixin should use the Field layout or a derivation thereof to properly size and position the label and message according to the component config. They must also call the initLabelable method during component initialization to ensure the mixin gets set up correctly.

items.name: activeError
items.text: If specified, then the component will be displayed with this value as its active error when first rendered. Use setActiveError or unsetActiveError to change it after component creation.

items.name: activeErrorsTpl
items.text: The template used to format the Array of error messages passed to setActiveErrors into a single HTML string. if the msgTarget is title, it defaults to a list separated by new lines. Otherwise, it renders each message as an item in an unordered list.

items.name: afterBodyEl
items.text: An optional string or `XTemplate` configuration to insert in the field markup at the end of the input containing element. If an `XTemplate` is used, the component's Ext.Component#renderData serves as the context.

items.name: afterLabelTextTpl
items.text: An optional string or `XTemplate` configuration to insert in the field markup after the label text. If an `XTemplate` is used, the component's Ext.Component#renderData serves as the context.

items.name: afterLabelTpl
items.text: An optional string or `XTemplate` configuration to insert in the field markup after the label element. If an `XTemplate` is used, the component's Ext.Component#renderData serves as the context.

items.name: afterSubTpl
items.text: An optional string or `XTemplate` configuration to insert in the field markup after the getSubTplMarkup. If an `XTemplate` is used, the component's Ext.Component#renderData serves as the context.

items.name: autoFitErrors
items.text: Whether to adjust the component's body width to make room for 'side' msgTarget.

items.name: baseBodyCls
items.text: The CSS class to be applied to the body content element.

items.name: beforeBodyEl
items.text: An optional string or `XTemplate` configuration to insert in the field markup at the beginning of the input containing element. If an `XTemplate` is used, the component's Ext.Component#renderData serves as the context.

items.name: beforeLabelTextTpl
items.text: An optional string or `XTemplate` configuration to insert in the field markup before the label text. If an `XTemplate` is used, the component's Ext.Component#renderData serves as the context.

items.name: beforeLabelTpl
items.text: An optional string or `XTemplate` configuration to insert in the field markup before the label element. If an `XTemplate` is used, the component's Ext.Component#renderData serves as the context.

items.name: beforeSubTpl
items.text: An optional string or `XTemplate` configuration to insert in the field markup before the getSubTplMarkup. If an `XTemplate` is used, the component's Ext.Component#renderData serves as the context.

items.name: errorMsgCls
items.text: The CSS class to be applied to the error message element.

items.name: fieldBodyCls
items.text: An extra CSS class to be applied to the body content element in addition to baseBodyCls.

items.name: fieldLabel
items.text: The label for the field. It gets appended with the labelSeparator, and its position and sizing is determined by the labelAlign and labelWidth configs.

items.name: formItemCls
items.text: A CSS class to be applied to the outermost element to denote that it is participating in the form field layout.

items.name: hideEmptyLabel
items.text: When set to true, the label element (fieldLabel and labelSeparator) will be automatically hidden if the fieldLabel is empty. Setting this to false will cause the empty label element to be rendered and space to be reserved for it; this is useful if you want a field without a label to line up with other labeled fields in the same form. If you wish to unconditionall hide the label even if a non-empty fieldLabel is configured, then set the hideLabel config to true.

items.name: hideLabel
items.text: Set to true to completely hide the label element (fieldLabel and labelSeparator). Also see hideEmptyLabel, which controls whether space will be reserved for an empty fieldLabel.

items.name: invalidCls
items.text: The CSS class to use when marking the component invalid.

items.name: labelableRenderTpl
items.text: The rendering template for the field decorations. Component classes using this mixin should include logic to use this as their Ext.Component#renderTpl, and implement the getSubTplMarkup method to generate the field body content.

items.name: labelAlign
items.text: Controls the position and alignment of the fieldLabel. Valid values are: - "left" (the default) - The label is positioned to the left of the field, with its text aligned to the left. Its width is determined by the labelWidth config. - "top" - The label is positioned above the field. - "right" - The label is positioned to the left of the field, with its text aligned to the right. Its width is determined by the labelWidth config.

items.name: labelAttrTpl
items.text: An optional string or `XTemplate` configuration to insert in the field markup inside the label element (as attributes). If an `XTemplate` is used, the component's Ext.Component#renderData serves as the context.

items.name: labelCls
items.text: The CSS class to be applied to the label element. This (single) CSS class is used to formulate the renderSelector and drives the field layout where it is concatenated with a hyphen ('-') and labelAlign. To add additional classes, use labelClsExtra.

items.name: labelClsExtra
items.text: An optional string of one or more additional CSS classes to add to the label element. Defaults to empty.

items.name: labelPad
items.text: The amount of space in pixels between the fieldLabel and the field body. This defaults to `5` for compatibility with Ext JS 4, however, as of Ext JS 5 the space between the label and the body can optionally be determined by the theme using the $form-label-horizontal-spacing (for side-aligned labels) and $form-label-vertical-spacing (for top-aligned labels) SASS variables. In order for the stylesheet values as to take effect, you must use a labelPad value of null.

items.name: labelSeparator
items.text: Character(s) to be inserted at the end of the fieldLabel. Set to empty string to hide the separator completely.

items.name: labelStyle
items.text: A CSS style specification string to apply directly to this field's label.

items.name: labelWidth
items.text: The width of the fieldLabel in pixels. Only applicable if labelAlign is set to "left" or "right".

items.name: msgTarget
items.text: The location where the error message text should display. Must be one of the following values: - `qtip` Display a quick tip containing the message when the user hovers over the field. This is the default. **Ext.tip.QuickTipManager#init must have been called for this setting to work.** - `title` Display the message in a default browser title attribute popup. - `under` Add a block div beneath the field containing the error message. - `side` Add an error icon to the right of the field, displaying the message in a popup on hover. - `none` Don't display any error message. This might be useful if you are implementing custom error display. - `[element id]` Add the error message directly to the innerHTML of the specified element.

items.name: preventMark
items.text: true to disable displaying any setActiveError set on this object.

items.name: errorchange
items.text: Fires when the active error message is changed via setActiveError.

items.name: error
items.text: The active error message

items.name: constructor
items.text: Creates new Object.

items.name: value
items.text: The value to wrap.

items.name: getActiveError
items.text:
Gets the active error message for this component, if any. This does not trigger validation on its own, it merely
returns any message that the component may already hold.
The active error message on the component; if there is no error, an empty string is returned.

items.name: getActiveErrors
items.text:
Gets an Array of any active error messages currently applied to the field. This does not trigger validation on
its own, it merely returns any messages that the component may already hold.

The active error messages on the component; if there are no errors, an empty Array is
returned.

items.name: getFieldLabel
items.text: Returns the label for the field. Defaults to simply returning the fieldLabel config. Can be overridden to provide a custom generated label.
The configured field label, or empty string if not defined

items.name: getInputId
items.text:
Get the input id, if any, for this component. This is used as the "for" attribute on the label element.
Implementing subclasses may also use this as e.g. the id for their own input element.
The input id

items.name: getLabelableRenderData
items.text: Generates the arguments for the field decorations labelableRenderTpl.

items.name: data
items.text:
optional object to use as the base data object.  If provided,
this method will add properties to the base object instead of creating a new one.
The template arguments

items.name: getSubTplMarkup
items.text:
Gets the markup to be inserted into the outer template's bodyEl. Defaults to empty string, should be implemented
by classes including this mixin as needed.
The markup to be inserted

items.name: hasActiveError
items.text:
Tells whether the field currently has an active error message. This does not trigger validation on its own, it
merely looks for any message that the component may already hold.

items.name: hasOwnProperty
prop
items.text: The name of the property to test.

Returns true if object contains specified property; else
returns false.

items.name: hasVisibleLabel
items.text: Checks if the field has a visible label
True if the field has a visible label

items.name: initLabelable
items.text:
Performs initialization of this mixin. Component classes using this mixin should call this method during their
own initialization.

items.name: isPrototypeOf
prototype
items.text:
an object to be tested against each link in the prototype chain of the
*object* argument

items.name: object
items.text: the object whose prototype chain will be searched
Returns true if object is a prototype and false if not.

items.name: propertyIsEnumerable
prop
items.text: The name of the property to test.

If the object does not have the specified property, this
method returns false.

items.name: renderActiveError
items.text:
Updates the rendered DOM to match the current activeError. This only updates the content and
attributes, you'll have to call doComponentLayout to actually update the display.

items.name: setActiveError
items.text: Sets the active error message to the given string. This replaces the entire error message contents with the given string. Also see setActiveErrors which accepts an Array of messages and formats them according to the activeErrorsTpl. Note that this only updates the error message element's text and attributes, you'll have to call doComponentLayout to actually update the field's layout to match. If the field extends Ext.form.field.Base you should call Ext.form.field.Base#markInvalid instead.

items.name: msg
items.text: The error message

items.name: setActiveErrors
items.text: Set the active error message to an Array of error messages. The messages are formatted into a single message string using the activeErrorsTpl. Also see setActiveError which allows setting the entire error contents with a single string. Note that this only updates the error message element's text and attributes, you'll have to call doComponentLayout to actually update the field's layout to match. If the field extends Ext.form.field.Base you should call Ext.form.field.Base#markInvalid instead.

items.name: errors
items.text: The error messages

items.name: setFieldDefaults
items.text:
Applies a set of default configuration values to this Labelable instance. For each of the properties in the given
object, check if this component hasOwnProperty that config; if not then it's inheriting a default value from its
prototype and we should apply the default value.

items.name: defaults
items.text: The defaults to apply to the object.

items.name: setFieldLabel
items.text: Set the label of this field.

items.name: label
items.text: The new label. The labelSeparator will be automatically appended to the label string.

items.name: toggleInvalidCls
items.text: Add/remove invalid class(es)

items.name: toLocaleString
items.text: Returns a string representing the object. This method is meant to be overridden by derived objects for locale-specific purposes. Objects toLocaleString returns the result of calling toString. This function is provided to give objects a generic toLocaleString method, even though not all may use it. Currently, only Array, Number, and Date override toLocaleString.
Object represented as a string.

items.name: toString

items.text: Object represented as a string.

items.name: trimLabelSeparator
items.text: Returns the trimmed label by slicing off the label separator character. Can be overridden.
The trimmed field label, or empty string if not defined

items.name: unsetActiveError
items.text: Clears the active error message(s). Note that this only clears the error message element's text and attributes, you'll have to call doComponentLayout to actually update the field's layout to match. If the field extends Ext.form.field.Base you should call Ext.form.field.Base#clearInvalid instead.

items.name: valueOf
items.text: Returns the primitive value of the specified object. JavaScript calls the valueOf method to convert an object to a primitive value. You rarely need to invoke the valueOf method yourself; JavaScript automatically invokes it when encountering an object where a primitive value is expected. By default, the valueOf method is inherited by every object descended from Object. Every built- in core object overrides this method to return an appropriate value. If an object has no primitive value, valueOf returns the object itself, which is displayed as: [object Object] You can use valueOf within your own code to convert a built-in object into a primitive value. When you create a custom object, you can override `Object.valueOf` to call a custom method instead of the default Object method. You can create a function to be called in place of the default valueOf method. Your function must take no arguments. Suppose you have an object type `myNumberType` and you want to create a valueOf method for it. The following code assigns a user-defined function to the object's valueOf method: myNumberType.prototype.valueOf = new Function(functionText) With the preceding code in place, any time an object of type `myNumberType` is used in a context where it is to be represented as a primitive value, JavaScript automatically calls the function defined in the preceding code. An object's valueOf method is usually invoked by JavaScript, but you can invoke it yourself as follows: myNumber.valueOf() Note: Objects in string contexts convert via the toString method, which is different from String objects converting to string primitives using valueOf. All objects have a string conversion, if only `"[object type]"`. But many objects do not convert to number, boolean, or function.
Returns value of the object or the object itself.

items.name: bodyEl
items.text: The div Element wrapping the component's contents. Only available after the component has been rendered.

items.name: constructor
errorEl
items.text: The div Element that will contain the component's error message(s). Note that depending on the configured msgTarget, this element may be hidden in favor of some other form of presentation, but will always be present in the DOM for use by assistive technologies.

items.name: isFieldLabelable
items.text: Flag denoting that this object is labelable as a field. Always true.

items.name: labelEl
items.text: The label Element for this component. Only available after the component has been rendered.

items.name: msgTargets
items.text:
Map for msg target lookup, if target is not in this map it is assumed
to be an element id

items.name: noWrap
items.text: Tells the layout system that the height can be measured immediately because the width does not need setting.

items.name: prototype
items.text: Allows the addition of properties to all objects of type Object.

items.name: destroyTip
items.text: Destroy the error tip instance.

items.name: initTip
items.text:
Use a custom QuickTip instance separate from the main QuickTips singleton, so that we
can give it a custom frame style. Responds to errorqtip rather than the qtip property.

items.name: $form-error-icon-background-image
items.text: The background image for error icons

items.name: $form-error-icon-height
items.text: Height for form error icons.

items.name: $form-error-icon-side-margin
items.text: Margin for error icons that are aligned to the side of the field

items.name: $form-error-icon-width
items.text: Width for form error icons.

items.name: $form-error-msg-color
items.text: The text color of form error messages

items.name: $form-error-msg-font-family
items.text: The font-family of form error messages

items.name: $form-error-msg-font-size
items.text: The font-size of form error messages

items.name: $form-error-msg-font-weight
items.text: The font-weight of form error messages

items.name: $form-error-msg-line-height
items.text: The line-height of form error messages

items.name: $form-error-under-icon-spacing
items.text: The space between the icon and the message for errors that display under the field

items.name: $form-error-under-padding
items.text: The padding on errors that display under the form field

items.name: $form-field-disabled-opacity
items.text: Opacity of disabled form fields

items.name: $form-item-margin-bottom
items.text:
The bottom margin to apply to form items when in auto, anchor, vbox, or table layout.
This value is also used as the default border-spacing in a form-layout.

items.name: $form-label-font-color
items.text: The text color of form field labels

items.name: $form-label-font-family
items.text: The font-family of form field labels

items.name: $form-label-font-size
items.text: The font-size of form field labels

items.name: $form-label-font-weight
items.text: The font-weight of form field labels

items.name: $form-label-horizontal-spacing
items.text: Horizontal space between the label and the field body when the label is left-aligned.

items.name: $form-label-line-height
items.text: The line-height of form field labels

items.name: $form-label-vertical-spacing
items.text: Vertical space between the label and the field body when the label is top-aligned.

items.name: $form-toolbar-error-icon-background-image
items.text: The background image for toolbar field error icons

items.name: $form-toolbar-error-icon-height
items.text: Height for toolbar field error icons.

items.name: $form-toolbar-error-icon-side-margin
items.text: Margin for toolbar field error icons that are aligned to the side of the field

items.name: $form-toolbar-error-icon-width
items.text: Width for toolbar field error icons.

items.name: $form-toolbar-error-msg-color
items.text: The text color of toolbar form error messages

items.name: $form-toolbar-error-msg-font-family
items.text: The font-family of toolbar form field error messages

items.name: $form-toolbar-error-msg-font-size
items.text: The font-size of toolbar form field error messages

items.name: $form-toolbar-error-msg-font-weight
items.text: The font-weight of toolbar form field error messages

items.name: $form-toolbar-error-msg-line-height
items.text: The line-height of toolbar form field error messages

items.name: $form-toolbar-error-under-icon-spacing
items.text: The space between the icon and the message for errors that display under a toolbar field

items.name: $form-toolbar-error-under-padding
items.text: The padding on errors that display under the toolbar form field

items.name: $form-toolbar-field-disabled-opacity
items.text: Opacity of disabled toolbar form fields

items.name: $form-toolbar-label-font-color
items.text: The text color of toolbar form field labels

items.name: $form-toolbar-label-font-family
items.text: The font-family of toolbar form field labels

items.name: $form-toolbar-label-font-size
items.text: The font-size of toolbar form field labels

items.name: $form-toolbar-label-font-weight
items.text: The font-weight of toolbar form field labels

items.name: $form-toolbar-label-horizontal-spacing
items.text: Horizontal space between the toolbar field's label and the field body when the label is left-aligned.

items.name: $form-toolbar-label-line-height
items.text: The line-height of toolbar form field labels

items.name: $form-toolbar-label-vertical-spacing
items.text: Vertical space between the toolbar field's label and the field body when the label is top-aligned.

items.name: $include-label-default-ui
items.text: True to include the "default" label UI

items.name: $include-label-toolbar-ui
items.text: True to include the "default" label UI
